synopsis.text: Doremi and her four best friends Aiko, Hazuki, Onpu, and Momoko travel to Doremi's grandparents' home in the countryside during summer vacation. There, they hear whispers of a legend about a magical frog stone located on the nearby Fukuyama Mountain. The local legend tells of a woman named Mayuri who lived in the area long ago when magic still flowed freely. Mayuri fell deeply in love with a man named Zenjuro, but their romance was tragically cut short when Zenjuro was killed by order of the then-ruler. Distraught, Mayuri threw herself into the river and drowned. Locals later found a strange crying frog creature near her body and erected a commemorative frog stone monument to honor the doomed lovers. Despite warnings from the adults not to venture out on the night of the smiling moon, Doremi and her curious friends feel compelled to visit the legendary frog stone themselves. As they climb the mountain, traces of magic seem to spring up around them and details of the legend slowly appear to come alive...
synopsis.author: anthropic.claude-v2:1
